snippet: Militants descended Saturday evening on the small village of Dalori, where they unleashed a torrent of gunfire, set homes ablaze, blew up fleeing residents and abducted children.
abstract: Nigerian officials say Boko Haram rampage on town of Dalori killed 65 people; militant group, which declared allegiance to Islamic State in 2015, has increased terrorist attacks as military campaign reversed its territorial gains; some fear group is regaining strength as country's economy reels from decline in oil prices.

byline.original: By ILIYA KURE and DIONNE SEARCEY
byline.contributor: Iliya Kure reported from Kaduna, and Dionne Searcey from Dakar, Senegal. Shehu Abubakar contributed reporting from Maiduguri, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: Militants descended Saturday evening on the small village of Dalori, where they unleashed a torrent of gunfire, set homes ablaze, blew up fleeing residents and abducted children.

headline.main: Boko Haram Raid in Nigeria Kills at Least 65
headline.print_headline: Deadly Rampage by Boko Haram Continues a Wave of Brutality

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
